review.body: I want to live on meerkat island

Oscar Wilde had intrigued my interest in his plays when I read “The Importance of Being Earnest.” It was so funny and such a good read that I decided to choose, “An Ideal Husband,” for this outside reading round. Although it is not as comedic as the other one, “An Ideal Husband,” was no disappoin...
Finally!! I've been wanting to read this for so long but couldn't find the physical copy anywhere and I'm too stubborn to read an ebook

book.title: The Secret History of Wonder Woman

review.body: A solid work of history exploring the people and movements which resulted in the creation of Wonder Woman.

book.title: Wild: From Lost to Found on the Pacific Crest Trail

review.body: I enjoyed this book, though selfishly wished there was more of Oregon and less California. Although I couldn't relate to many of Strayed's life experiences, I can relate to the heart of the reason for her journey. I'm not sure I would ever be able to do the journey, but it sure sounds like it mig...

book.title: Far Cry from the Turquoise Room

review.body: This is a beautifully written and touching story of tragedy and redemption. As with Rigby's other novels, the child's eye is used perfectly to draw us into family life and all it's flaws, using Leila, the daughter of wealthy Iranian Hassan, as the main narrator. The story does jump back and forth...

book.title: MineCraft: Diary of a Pigman [An Unofficial MineCraft Book] For kids who like: Diary of a Wimpy Kid, Minecraft Diary, Minecraft Books for Kids, Minecraft Diary Books

review.body:
Bad

Who ever thought of a silver pickaxe it goes like would to stone stone to iron iron to gold and gold to diamond.

This was an adorable story of a little girl sent to spend the summer with her grandfather while her parents deal with substance abuse issues with her older brother. Wonderfully handled and appropriate for 9+.

book.title: No Place
book.publisher: Simon & Schuster Books for Young Readers

review.body: 2016-2017 Truman Final Nominee
Sheer enjoyment, another great story by Lianne Moriarty who seems to be able to craft every character so perfectly that you see some of yourself in them all, perfectly rounded ending.

When his father dies, 17-year-old Evan finds a yellow journal written on a Pacific island during WWII. It is a story of life and death, real and surreal. Meanwhile Evan is locked in a battle with his grandfather who harbours a few mysteries of his own. Local author Tim Wynne-Jones has taken story...

book.title: A Billionaire After Dark (The Overnight Billionaires, #2)

review.body: When ethics and heat collide, will someone get burned in the name of love? I am really becoming a fan of Ms. Lane. Her stories are more than just sensual reads. They are heartfelt expressions of the merry-go-round that is love. Through her writing she examines the euphoria and the pitfalls of thi...

book.title: A Small Tall Tale from the Far Far North

review.body: What a fascinating story and beautifully illustrated about a Czech folk hero that I bet not many people (including me) have heard about.

The Line is an incredibly subtle and playful wordless picturebook which draws a story made simply of an imaginative interaction between a young child and a drawn pencil line. The main character discovers the power a simple line has to be transformative; becoming curvy, looping in circles and evol...

book.title: Law of Attraction: Crucial Secrets on How to Attract and Manifest the Lifestyle You Want

review.body:
Clear and concise

It has really down to earth simple techniques to make the Loa successful. Students of the loa will love it.

There are no words for this story. Beyond my expectations, is all I have to say. This book delves to the bondage world. It's steamy, hot and a page turner. Nick Colton is my new book boyfriend. His journey through this book is wild and fantasy fulfilling. A worthwhile read of any book lover.
Jacob read on his own and to Dad some nights before bed..krb 3/24/16
I think a soccer playing girl would adore this book.

book.title: So Long, Insecurity: You've Been A Bad Friend To Us

review.body: Very good no matter what level of insecurity you feel in your life. Lots of inspiration for women of all ages.

book.title: Tempted by the Tiger (Riverford Shifters Book 4)

review.body:
Awesome action and adventure with a possible new love story mixed in.
Action packed from the go. When Kylie and Hunter go to Great Britain to warn her mother's clan of a possible attack, but are attacked themselves and go missing. Maxim goes to see if he can find any trace to when they are and wha...
